alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Comanche; Grady; Kiowa; McClain; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 1:41PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma and southwest Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Cleveland, Grady, McClain and Pottawatomie. In southwest Oklahoma, Comanche and Kiowa. * WHEN...Through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms are expected later today through Wednesday. Some of these storms may produce locally heavy rainfall, and flooding will be possible especially in areas where numerous thunderstorms move through the same locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Comanche; Grady; Kiowa; McClain; Pottawatomie
